meeting_summary: Organizational meeting focused on procedural matters including adopting Rules of Procedure with amended special meeting notice requirements, approving 2025 meeting schedule, authorizing training attendance, setting mileage reimbursement rates, and designating official depositories and newspaper. Significant tension between Trustees Baskin/Raymond and Mayor/Attorney regarding legality of January 2 meeting, with Attorney Buettner firmly stating meeting was legal while Trustees Baskin and Raymond continued to assert it was illegal.

votes.motion_description: Adopt Rules of Procedure as amended at January 2, 2025 Special Meeting and amended further to take into consideration 2026 Organizational Meeting and appointments

discussion.statement: continued his disagreement from the last meeting regarding when Organizational Meetings are held

votes.motion_description: Amend Rules of Procedure: Special meetings called by Mayor or any two Board members; Clerk notifies official newspaper at least 72 hours in advance if meeting scheduled a week or more in advance, at least 24 hours if less than a week in advance
votes.notes: Amended motion; Mayor had not yet entered meeting via Zoom

votes.motion_description: Approve attached schedule of regular Board of Trustees meetings for calendar year 2025

Authorize Village officials and employees to attend training conferences and schools including NY Conference of Mayors Annual Meeting and Training School, Fall Training School for Finance Officers and Municipal Clerks, and Schools for DPW Working Supervisors
votes.notes: Authorizes Board of Trustees, Village Clerk, Village Treasurer, Deputy Village Treasurer, Accounting Assistant, DPW Working Supervisor and other employees as determined by Mayor

votes.motion_description: Approve mileage reimbursement for officers and employees at current IRS reimbursement rate

Designate official depositories (Adirondack Trust Co., Generations Bank, NYCLASS), designate Daily Gazette as official newspaper, authorize Village Clerk to send meeting schedule to news media, and appoint Field Horne as Village Historian for one year ending December 31, 2025

public_comments.comment_text: asked for clarification on organizational meetings and also said she is disappointed that the two people who were not reappointed were not told.
public_comments.summary: Requests clarification on organizational meetings; disappointed two people not reappointed were not notified

board_response.response: explained that there is nothing in State law that requires, defines, or sets an agenda for an organizational meeting. Attorney Buettner stressed that there is nothing violative by any law about the last meeting or this meeting, as she has told the Board multiple times

other_business.speaker: Multiple
other_business.update: Extended heated discussion about legality of January 2 meeting. Trustee Baskin said in his opinion the January 2 meeting was illegal. Attorney Buettner asked for specifics. Trustee Baskin thinks it was the Organizational meeting and improperly scheduled. Attorney Buettner stated it is her legal opinion that there was nothing illegal about that meeting. Trustee Raymond countered that another attorney could have a different opinion. Trustee VanDeinse-Perez stated that as a Trustee it is irresponsible to continue to assert the Village has violated the law; our counsel has said over and over we have not violated the law. Trustees Raymond and Baskin continued to disagree. Trustee Baskin accused Mayor Rossi of doing this to accommodate his own schedule. Mayor Rossi stated it is infuriating for it to be insinuated that he schedules to accommodate his personal schedule and that he doesn't do his job. The Mayor noted that the Village always comes first and chastised Trustee Baskin for impugning the Village and for taking it to Facebook and the press. Mayor Rossi stated it is an ethical violation for the Trustees to say the meeting was illegal and noted he would appreciate a retraction and an apology.
action_items: Mayor requests retraction and apology from Trustees regarding illegal meeting claims
